page.title: 19RELIGION
page.content: Combeinteignhead church is not named after a saint. It is about 400 years old, and has a tower, stained glass windows and is surrounded by a graveyard which is still in use. There are six bells in the tower. From the top of the tower you can see the river Teign. Stokeinteignhead church is named after St.Andrew. It is about 400 years old and has an old screen. It is surrounded by a graveyard and has some stained glass windows. The tower holds six bells. The church has an Elizabethan bras of Sir Thomas Taggel. Haccombe church is very small. It stands next to a Georgian Mansion which is itself on the site of a medieval manor. There is a mention of Haccombe in the original Domesday Book. The church has many old brasses some with coats of arms of the Carew family engraved on them.
